detailsOfAchievement: SEARCH was founded in Gadchiroli district in the year 1986. It is inspired by a social philosophy of Mahatma Gandhi. Its founders Dr.Abhay Bang and Dr.Rani Bang , received their medical training in India and their public health training at John Hopkins University. The organizations three missions are 1) providing health care to the local populations 2) training and education in health 3) Research to help shape health policies. SEARCH emphasizes that that field research should be conducted with full participation of local communities. Its community health action and research approach highlights the importance of living close to, and listening carefully to the health concerns of local communities.Research and solution building activities should then be structured around central health concerns as voiced by community members themselves. Solutions to health problems are tested rigorous field based trials, and then published for scrutiny by the scientific community and policy makers. SEARCH conducted a field trial in Gadchiroli on home based neonatal care from 1993-1998. SEARCH trained village health workers to make home visits, and manage birth asyphyxia, pre mature birth or low birth weight, hypotheremia, breast feeding problems, in addition to diagnosing and treating neonatal sepsis (septicamia, meaningitis and pneumonia). identified 39 intervention and 47 control villages in Gadchiroli district, with the study results demonstrating that SEARCH home based new born with HBNC approach reduced neonatal and infant mortality by nearly 50%. SEARCH maintains comprehensive Demographic Surveillance system in Gadchiroli, which records all births, deaths, migrations in and out, and marriages in that area. Its activities have now expanded into the areas of non communicable diseases, tobacco and alcohol consumption and adolescent reproductive youth, Youth sports for overall development etc......

Gender Equity has also spread through working with 64 youth groups in Dharavi, in schools and 50 womenâ€™s groups. â€¢ National Integration and Communal Harmony Traumatized people after the 1992/93 riots in Dharavi were rehabilitated and given counselling sessions. SHEDâ€™s deep involvement in Communal Harmony continues. â€¢ Creche and Balwadis SHED runs a Creche at Dharavi for working mothers and Balwadis at Kalina and Mahakali Centres. A nourishing mid-morning mini-meal is provided to all the pupils. â€¢ SHED English Primary School, Dharavi There are 564 pupils staying from Std. I to Std. VI. â€¢ Mahila Mandals 59 Mahila Mandals have been established including 15 in Dharavi. Among other things, the Mandals with assistance from SHEDâ€™s staff provide help to victims of domestic violence, violence against women, etc. by liaisoning with local authorities and the police. â€¢ Family Counselling Over 34,000 poignant cases have been resolved including those of destitute old women thrown out of their homes by their adult children, but now cared for. â€¢ Family Planning SHED has trained grassroots workers of NGOs in this. Over 48,000 people in Dharavi alone have adopted Family Planning methods. â€¢ AIDS Intervention AIDS Intervention and awareness has been extended to 60,000 people, as well as 56,000 male migrants and 3000 bar girls and their clients. â€¢ Health and Hygiene in our slum and Rural Projects In the year 2003, SHED initiated a programme for â€œPersonal Health, Hygiene and Sanitationâ€ in 10 villages of Saphale. This programme required the construction of a low cost toilet which was successfully built and operated. Thereafter, Awareness Workshops for Hygiene and Sanitation, as well as Vocational Training classes for Masons enabled us to spread the programme out to over 60 villages and hamlets. We are proud to confirm that our venture has been 100% successful. Today, approximately 40,000 families are using these low cost toilets. A Health Centre in Dharavi, a weekly Homeopathy Clinic at Kalina Centre and Health, Hygiene and Sanitation Programmes are being run in 4 Municipal Schools. â€¢ Self Help Groups for senior citizens SHED has many ways in which we have been supporting and helping senior citizens. detailsOfAchievement: In 1980 we have established Subhash Shikshan Sanstha with the aim of Education and Social Work Purpose. Since 1991, we started the Primary School named as Adarsh Primary School in Maindargi which is approved from Government of Maharashtra. There are two hundred five students studying in first std to fifth std and five teachers are working in the school. Since 1987 we also started vastigruh (Hostel) for backward caste students which is approved by Zilla Parishad Solapur. 42 backward caste students are taking benefits of this vastigruh. In 2015 we received Award for best Vastigruh in solapur District. Since 1982 we are also running CRECHE in Maindargi which is approved by Maharashtra State Welfare Board.
